title.narrative: Enhancing the Government of Niger's Capacities to Implement Anti-Trafficking Legislation and to Promote Protection of Victims

description.narrative: IOM will continue to support the Government of Niger to combat TIP by assisting it to implement the 2010 anti-TIP law and prevent the trafficking of Nigerien nationals returning from Libya. Specifically, it will support the establishment of a National Commission (in charge of anti-TIP policy) and a National Agency (in charge of policy implementation) and provide technical assistance to both. It will also enhance the ability of state and non-state actors to provide protection services to TIP victims and raise awareness about the new law.

title.narrative: Collaborative Investigation of Ceramic Traditions and Techniques of the Village of Boubon

description.narrative: In this project, the Davis Museum at Wellesley College in Massachusetts and the NGO Culture, Arts & Humanity of Niger are teaming up to preserve the traditions and support the livelihoods of the women ceramicists of Boubon, whose distinctive style of pottery bears witness to the cultural, economic, and social contexts of Niger. Support for this project comes from the AFCP 20th Anniversary Partnership Program, a State Department special initiative.
